priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Reproductive System Findings Test Code Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C106479

self.title: CDISC SDTM Reproductive System Findings Test Code Terminology

definition: A terminology codelist for the physiological test codes related to the male and female reproductive systems.
name: Reproductive System Findings Test Code
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Reproductive System Findings Test Code Terminology

terms.definition: A measurement of the total number of instances in which there has been a spontaneous termination of pregnancy (miscarriage) or elective termination of pregnancy.
The date on which the delivery event occurred.
The method by which conception or impregnation is prevented.
An indication as to whether there is the presence of abnormal bleeding.
An indication as to whether blistering occurred.
A measurement of the total number of live birth events at which the gestational age of the neonate is 39 weeks and 0 days through 40 weeks and 6 days.
terms.preferredTerm: Number of Full Term Live Births

terms.definition: A measurement of the total number of live-born offspring a female has delivered.
A measurement of the total number of birth events experienced by a female.
A measurement of the total number of live birth events at which the gestational age of the neonate is less than 37 weeks and 0 days.

A measurement of the total number of birth events at which the fetus is of at least 20 weeks gestation, or of a birth weight of at least 350 grams if the gestational age is unknown, which is born without signs of life at the time of delivery, and with an Apgar score of zero at both one and five minutes.
An indication as to whether the subject has ever delivered live-born offspring.
An indication as to whether the Bartholin's gland is abnormal.
An indication as to whether any abnormality was present at birth or during the neonatal period.
An indicator as to whether the female subject has the potential to become pregnant. (NCI)
Description of the method by which a fetus is delivered.
An indication as to whether there is the presence of discharge.
An indication as to whether ecchymosis is present.
A measurement of the total number of ectopic pregnancies experienced by a female subject.
An approximate calculated date at which the conception event took place.
An indication as to whether edema is present.
An approximate calculation of the delivery date.
An approximate calculation of the gestational age of the fetus.
The approximate date of the first day of the next menstrual cycle.
terms.preferredTerm: Estimated Next Menstrual Period Start Date
synonyms: Est Next Menstrual Period Start Date
Estimated Next Menstrual Period Start Date

terms.definition: A measurement of the total number of birth events at which the gestational age of the neonate is 37 weeks and 0 days through 38 weeks and 6 days.
An indication as to whether erythema is present.
A measurement of the total number of fetal deaths (death of a fetus at 16 weeks, 0 days to 19 weeks, 6 days of gestation)  experienced by a female subject.
A measurement of the total number of birth events (both live and dead) at which the gestational age of the neonate is 39 weeks and 0 days through 40 weeks and 6 days.
A measurement of the distance between the pubic symphysis and the top of the palpable uterus.
An indication as to whether the subject is or has ever been pregnant.
An indication as to whether the individual was hospitalized due to a pregnancy complication.
terms.preferredTerm: Hospitalized Due to Pregnancy Complication Indicator
synonyms: Hosp Due to Pregnancy Complication Ind
Hospitalized Due to Pregnancy Complication Indicator

terms.definition: An indication as to whether the female subject has ever had an induced abortion procedure.
A measurement of the total number of induced abortions experienced by a female subject.

An act or process of elucidation; explication, or explanation of the meaning of the event or thing via the assignment of objects from the domain to the constants of a formal language, truth-values to the proposition symbols, truth-functions to the connectives, other functions to the function symbols, and extensions to the predicates, if any. The assignments are result of human logic application and are not native to the symbols of the formal language.
The first day of the most recent menstrual cycle.
An indication as to whether a mass is present.
The age at which the first menstruation event occurred. (NCI)
The length of time during which menses is expelled from the uterus.
A subjective description of the menstrual flow rate during a menstrual cycle.
The age at which permanent cessation of menses occurred. (NCI)
The status of a female with respect to menopause.
A description of how an individual's menstrual cycle conforms to a consistent temporal pattern.
The length of time of the menses cycle, measured from the beginning of one menstrual period to the beginning of the next.
An indication as to whether any pregnancies resulted in miscarriages.
An indication as to whether there are symptoms of motion tenderness.
The number of pregnancies reaching 20 weeks and 0 days of gestation or beyond, regardless of the number of fetuses or outcomes. (NICHD)
An indication as to whether the subject's pregnancy has been confirmed.
An indication as to whether there is the presence of peeling.
An indication as to whether the products of conception have been examined.
An indication as to whether the subject or associated person is pregnant at the time the question is asked.
A measurement of the total number of pregnancy events experienced by a female.
An indicator as to whether a female is pregnant during the study period. (NCI)
A measurement of the total number of birth events (both live and dead) at which the gestational age of the neonate is less than 37 weeks and 0 days.
The date on which the pregnancy ended.
Findings observed at the end of a pregnancy.
A measurement of the total number of pregnancy events experienced by the female subject prior to the current pregnancy.
An indication as to whether a pustule is present.
An indication as to whether rash is present.
An indication as to whether the Skene's gland is abnormal.
A measurement of the total number of spontaneous abortions (in which the fetus is less than 20 weeks gestational age) experienced by a female subject.
An indication as to whether any pregnancies resulted in stillbirths.
The dimension between two surfaces of an object, usually the smallest dimension as opposed to the width or the length.
An indication as to whether there are symptoms of tenderness.
A classification of the gestation duration of the pregnancy at the time of delivery.
An indication as to whether an ulcer is present.
A description of the frequency at which vaginal bleeding and/or spotting has occurred.
terms.preferredTerm: Vaginal Bleeding and/or Spotting Frequency Description
